subject: [Lab 13] Q6: The Price is Right
content:
Q6: The Price is Right

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q6: The Price is Right in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: Can anybody give a hint on how this problem should be implemented? I know that there is the MIN() operator, but that only returns the minimum price of everything. So how else do I find the minimum price of each category?

follow-ups.feedback: Remember that you can use the `GROUP BY` clause in order to group by a certain column, and all aggregator functions will aggregate by the group rather than the entire table.
Review the 11/20 lecture if you need a refresher on how exactly to use aggregation in SQL.
You are a god. Thank you.
